description: The tatting fern (Athyrium filix-femina 'Frizelliae') is a exotic and unique species of fern. It sets itself apart with its deep burgundy-purple fronds and contrasting silvery-green leaflets. Its feathery fronds can reach up to 12 inches long. This fern features an upright vase shape and looks great when planted in groups or along a shaded walkway. It's also deer resistant and drought tolerant, making it an ideal choice for shady gardens. The tatting fern adds texture, height, and color to the garden that will last all season.
